entries.meaning: The set of letters used when writing in a language.
examples: The Greek alphabet has only twenty-four letters.
In the first year of school, pupils are taught to recite the alphabet.

definitionGroups.group: A writing system in which letters represent phonemes. (Contrast e.g. logography, a writing system in which each character represents a word, and syllabary, in which each character represents a syllable.)

entries.meaning: A writing system in which there are letters for the consonant and vowel phonemes. (Contrast e.g. abjad.)
(computer science) A typically finite set of distinguishable symbols.
examples:
Let

entries.meaning: (India, Hong Kong, Singapore, Malaysia) An individual letter of an alphabet; an alphabetic character.
(Internet slang, politics) An agent of the FBI, the CIA, or another such government agency.

verbs.description: alphabet (third-person singular simple present alphabets, present participle alphabeting, simple past and past participle alphabeted)

entries.meaning: (rare) To designate by the letters of the alphabet; to arrange alphabetically.
